title: Gamas's Theorem
summary: Gamas's theorem is a result in multilinear algebra which states the necessary and sufficient conditions for a tensor symmetrized by an irreducible representation of the symmetric group S n {\displaystyle S_{n}} to be zero. It was proven in 1988 by Carlos Gamas.[1] Additional proofs have been given by Pate[2] and Berget.[3]
